name: String Of Pearls
climate: String of Pearls thrives in warm climates with temperatures between 70°F to 80°F.
It prefers a dry environment, avoiding humidity and excess moisture in the air.
This plant does well indoors where temperature fluctuations are minimal.
It is not frost-hardy and should be kept away from cold temperatures and drafts.
sunlight: String of Pearls requires bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, so avoid placing it in direct sun.
It can adapt to lower light conditions but may grow slower in shade.
A well-lit room with filtered light through curtains works perfectly.
watering: String of Pearls needs infrequent watering; let soil dry out completely.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so it's better to underwater than overwater.
During winter, reduce watering as the plant enters a dormant period.
Check every two weeks in growing season and when dry, water thoroughly.
soil: Use a well-draining, sandy cactus or succulent potting mix for this plant.
The soil must allow water to drain quickly to prevent root rot and waterlogging.
You can amend regular potting mix with sand or perlite for better drainage.
Ensure the pot has drainage holes to keep the soil from staying too moist.
toxic: String of Pearls is toxic to cats, dogs, and humans if ingested.
Symptoms of ingestion include vomiting, diarrhea, and drooling.
Keep this plant out of reach of pets and small children to prevent accidents.
Contact a veterinarian or doctor if ingestion is suspected.
extra_care_tip: String of Pearls can benefit from a mild cactus fertilizer during growing season.
Prune away any dead stems to encourage healthy growth and appearance.
Rotate the plant regularly for even growth as it reaches toward the light.
Ensure good air circulation around the plant to prevent fungal issues.
